severe tonsillitis.context: Severe tonsillitis, palatal cellulitis, and inability to swallow.

palatal cellulitis.context: Severe tonsillitis, palatal cellulitis, and inability to swallow.

inability to swallow.context: Severe tonsillitis, palatal cellulitis, and inability to swallow.

sore throat.context: This patient started having sore throat approximately one week ago; however, yesterday it became much worse.

pharyngeal, palatal, or peritonsillar ab.context: He was taken to Med Care and did not get any better, and therefore presented this morning to ER, where seen and evaluated by Dr. X and concerned as whether he had an abscess either pharyngeal, palatal, or peritonsillar.

extreme tonsillitis.context: He was noted to have extreme tonsillitis with kissing tonsils, marked exudates especially right side and right palatal cellulitis.

kissing tonsils.context: He was noted to have extreme tonsillitis with kissing tonsils, marked exudates especially right side and right palatal cellulitis.

right palatal cellulitis.context: He was noted to have extreme tonsillitis with kissing tonsils, marked exudates especially right side and right palatal cellulitis.

abscess.context: I do not insist that this patient will need surgical intervention since there is no evidence of abscess.

CT scan.context: A CT scan at ER did not show abscess.

airway compromise.context: He has not had airway compromise, but he has had difficulty swallowing.

difficulty swallowing.context: He has not had airway compromise, but he has had difficulty swallowing.

low-grade fever.context: He may have had a low-grade fever, but nothing marked at home.

leukocytosis.context: He did have some equivalent leukocytosis.

negative monospot.context: He had a negative monospot and negative strep screen.

significantly overweight.context: The patient takes no medications, has had no illnesses or surgeries and he is generally in good health other than being significantly overweight.

sophomore at High School.context: He is a sophomore at High School.

tonsillectomy.context: This one episode of severe tonsillitis does not mean the patient needs tonsillectomy, but if he continues to have significant tonsil problems after this he should be referred for ENT evaluation as an outpatient.
